data.title: How Does Rhaenyra TargaryenÔªø Die in House of the Dragon?
data.meta_description: Thanks to some major 'Game of Thrones' spoilers we know exactly how Rhaenyra Targaryen dies on 'House of the Dragon.' Here's how Rhaenyra will die.
data.text:
In case you'd forgotten, everything currently happening on House of the Dragon takes place hundreds of years before Game of Thrones. Meaning? The entire show is basically one giant spoiler. Also meaning? We know exactly what‚Äôs going to happen on HotD‚Äîincluding how Rhaenyra Targaryen dies. (Especially because the whole thing is based on an extensive "historical" text.)

The bad news: Now that things are popping off in season 2, it seems like this could happen at‚Ä¶basically any time. The even worse news: Rhaenyra doesn‚Äôt exactly die of old age in her bed. Like, her death is so shocking that someone legit gouges out their eyes while watching it go down.

It goes without saying that everything you‚Äôre about to read is a SPOILER, so buckle up. But honestly, if you watched Game of Thrones, you‚Äôve been spoiled anyway ‚Äôcause‚Ä¶.

Joffrey Revealed How Rhaenyra Dies in Game of Thrones

The moment happens in Game of Thrones season 3, episode 4, ‚ÄúAnd Now His Watch Is Ended,‚Äù when Joffrey Lannister is chilling with Margaery Tyrell and giddily explains, ‚ÄúRhaenyra Targaryen was murdered by her brother, or rather, his dragon. It ate her while her son watched. What‚Äôs left of her is buried in the crypts right down there.‚Äù

Like, okay, Joffrey, calm down!

Meanwhile, Shireen (Stannis Baratheon‚Äôs daughter) also does some more general spoiling during Game of Thrones season 5, episode 9, ‚ÄúThe Dance of the Dragons.‚Äù As she puts it, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the story of the fight between Rhaenyra Targaryen and her half-brother Aegon for control of the Seven Kingdoms. Both of them thought they belonged on the Iron Throne. When people started declaring for one of them or the other, their fight divided the kingdoms in two. Brothers fought brothers. Dragons fought dragons. By the time it was over, thousands were dead. And it was a disaster for the Targaryens as well. They never truly recovered.‚Äù

So What *Specifically* Happens to Rhaenyra?

According to Fire & Blood (the source material for House of the Dragon by George R. R. Martin), Aegon II has Rhaenyra killed and eaten by his dragon. Classic sibling behavior!

TL;DR: Rhaenyra and her üôÉ uncle-husband üôÉ Prince Daemon are fighting for her place on the Iron Throne, which leads to to the ~Dance of the Dragons~, the long and very bloody fight for the Iron Throne that we‚Äôre currently seeing play out on House of the Dragon season 2.

The good news for those of us who are Team Rhaenyra? She eventually does take the throne. For, like, a minute. Unfortunately, there‚Äôs a huge amount of unrest and rioting in King‚Äôs Landing once she gets there‚Äîwhich peaks when Princess Helaena (the üôÉ sister-wife üôÉ of Aegon II) takes her own life.

Rhaenyra ends up having to flee King‚Äôs Landing, and upon making it back to Dragonstone, she realizes (1) she‚Äôs been betrayed, (2) all her loyal followers are dead, and (3) Aegon II is already there. Not great, and apparently her first words to him are, ‚ÄúDear brother. I had hoped that you were dead.‚Äù

Things only get worse when Aegon straight-up has his dragon Sunfyre kill and eat Rhaenyra‚Äîin front of her last remaining child Prince Aegon the Younger. To quote Fire & Blood:

‚ÄúSunfyre, it is said, did not seem at first to take any interest in the offering, until Broome pricked the queen‚Äôs breast with his dagger. The smell of blood roused the dragon, who sniffed at Her Grace, then bathed her in a blast of flame, so suddenly that Ser Alfred‚Äôs cloak caught fire as he leapt away. Rhaenyra Targaryen had time to raise her head toward the sky and shriek out one last curse upon her half-brother before Sunfyre‚Äôs jaws closed round her, tearing off her arm and shoulder.‚Äù

In case that‚Äôs not enough gory detail for you, Sunfyre apparently ‚Äúdevoured the queen in six bites,‚Äù leaving only her ‚Äúleft leg below the shin.‚Äù A scene so horrifying that one of Rhaenyra‚Äôs ladies-in-waiting fully gouged out her own eyes at the sight of it, while Prince Aegon the Younger was so stunned that he was ‚Äúunable to move.‚Äù

And‚Ä¶that‚Äôs it. But fun fact: Prince Aegon later, and super ironically, ends up inheriting the throne, which is a story for another time‚Ä¶maybe season 3? TBD, lol.

When will this happen on the show?

Great question. If the show sticks to the timeline of the book, which it mostly has so far, we still have a ways to go before this ^ happens. Rhaenyra still has to temporarily rule from King's Landing, etc. So hopefully we have her around for at least another season or two.

Plus, Aegon is still, like, fully incapacitated in King's Landing. He'd have to make a pretty speedy recovery for this to happen by the end of this season. I can't see him traveling anywhere anytime soon.
